aniBsuStatistics.name: aniBsuStatistics
aniBsuStatistics.contactinfo: Postal: Aperto Networks Inc 1637 S Main Street Milpitas, California 95035 Tel: +1 408 719 9977
aniBsuStatistics.description: This group contains Statistical information for the BSU. aniBsuRfStatsTable shows the RF Port level statistics. aniBsuStatsBWGroup shows the bandwidth allocation statistics. aniBsuRfSigQStatsTable shows the Signal Quality Port level statistics.

aniBsuRfStatsTable.name: aniBsuRfStatsTable
aniBsuRfStatsTable.description: This table provides the statistics information for the BSU Wireless ports.

aniBsuRfStatsEntry.name: aniBsuRfStatsEntry
aniBsuRfStatsEntry.description: An entry with objects that provide statistics information for each RF port monitored by the BSU.

aniBsuRfStatsInPackets.name: aniBsuRfStatsInPackets
aniBsuRfStatsInPackets.description: This object counts total number of packets received through the Wireless port as identified by aniBsuWirelessPort.

aniBsuRfStatsOutPackets.name: aniBsuRfStatsOutPackets
aniBsuRfStatsOutPackets.description: This object counts total number of packets transmitted through the Wireless port as identified by aniBsuWirelessPort.

aniBsuRfStatsInOctets.name: aniBsuRfStatsInOctets
aniBsuRfStatsInOctets.description: The cumulative number of Packet Data Octets received on this Wireless port.

aniBsuRfStatsOutOctets.name: aniBsuRfStatsOutOctets
aniBsuRfStatsOutOctets.description: The cumulative number of Packet Data Octets transmitted on this Wireless port.

aniBsuRfStatsNumSusLinked.name: aniBsuRfStatsNumSusLinked
aniBsuRfStatsNumSusLinked.description: The number of SUs linked to this wireless port.

aniBsuStatsBWTable.name: aniBsuStatsBWTable
aniBsuStatsBWTable.description: This table shows the bandwidth allocation statistics per wireless port for each service class.

aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocation.name: aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocation
aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocation.description: The maximum upstream bandwidth allocation in bits per second. This value is available on the configuration manager.

aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocPercent.name: aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocPercent
aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocPercent.description: The maximum upstream bandwidth allocation displayed as a percentage.

aniBsuStatsBWUSCurrAllocation.name: aniBsuStatsBWUSCurrAllocation
aniBsuStatsBWUSCurrAllocation.description: The current upstream bandwidth allocation in bits per second. This value is the accumulation of all the SUs upstream allocated bandwidth for this service class on this wireless port. This object is not applicable in case of best effort service class and is always displayed as 0.

aniBsuStatsBWUSSubscrPercent.name: aniBsuStatsBWUSSubscrPercent
aniBsuStatsBWUSSubscrPercent.description: The ratio of aniBsuStatsBWUSCurrAllocPercent and aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocation displayed as a percentage. aniBsuStatsBWUSSubscrPercent = (aniBsuStatsBWUSCurrAllocPercent/aniBsuStatsBWUSMaxAllocation)*100 This object is not applicable in case of best effort service class and a string 'not-applicable' is returned.

aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocation.name: aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocation
aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocation.description: The maximum downstream bandwidth allocation in bits per second. This value is available on the configuration manager.

aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocPercent.name: aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocPercent
aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocPercent.description: The maximum downstream bandwidth allocation displayed as a percentage.

aniBsuStatsBWDSCurrAllocation.name: aniBsuStatsBWDSCurrAllocation
aniBsuStatsBWDSCurrAllocation.description: The current downstream bandwidth allocation in bits per second. This value is the accumulation of all the SUs downstream allocated bandwidth for this service class on this wireless port. This object is not applicable in case of best effort service class and is always displayed as 0.

aniBsuStatsBWDSSubscrPercent.name: aniBsuStatsBWDSSubscrPercent
aniBsuStatsBWDSSubscrPercent.description: The ratio of aniBsuStatsBWDSCurrAllocPercent and aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocation displayed as a percentage. aniBsuStatsBWDSSubscrPercent = (aniBsuStatsBWDSCurrAllocPercent/aniBsuStatsBWDSMaxAllocation)*100 This object is not applicable in case of best effort service class and a string 'not-applicable' is returned.

aniBsuStatsBWTotalTable.name: aniBsuStatsBWTotalTable
aniBsuStatsBWTotalTable.description: This table displays the total bandwidth allocation for each wireless port.

aniBsuStatsBWTotalUSMaxAllocation.name: aniBsuStatsBWTotalUSMaxAllocation
aniBsuStatsBWTotalUSMaxAllocation.description: The total upstream maximum bandwidth allocations for this wireless port. It includes bandwidth information of all the service classes on this particular port.

aniBsuStatsBWTotalDSMaxAllocation.name: aniBsuStatsBWTotalDSMaxAllocation
aniBsuStatsBWTotalDSMaxAllocation.description: The total downstream maximum bandwidth allocations for this wireless port. It includes bandwidth information of all the service classes on this particular port.

aniBsuRfSigQStatsTable.name: aniBsuRfSigQStatsTable
aniBsuRfSigQStatsTable.description: This table provides the signal quality statistics information for the BSU Wireless ports.

aniBsuRfSigQStatsEntry.name: aniBsuRfSigQStatsEntry
aniBsuRfSigQStatsEntry.description: An entry with objects that provide signal quality statistics information for each RF port monitored by the BSU.

aniBsuRfSigQStatsBurstErrorRate.name: aniBsuRfSigQStatsBurstErrorRate
aniBsuRfSigQStatsBurstErrorRate.description: The burst error rate. This percentage is calculated using the formula Burst Error Rate = (Bad Bursts/(Good Bursts + Bad Bursts)) x 100 where Good Bursts = aniBsuRfSigQStatsNoFecErrorCount + aniBsuRfSigQStatsCorrFecErrorCount Bad Bursts = aniBsuRfSigQStatsCollidedBurstCount + aniBsuRfSigQStatsNoUniqueWordCount + aniBsuRfSigQStatsUncorrFecErrorCount

aniBsuRfSigQStatsResetCounter.name: aniBsuRfSigQStatsResetCounter
aniBsuRfSigQStatsResetCounter.description: This provids an option to reset all the signal quality statistics counters for a particular wireless port. Setting this object to true(1) resets the counters to 0. Setting the object to false(2) is not allowed. If a Get request is sent, the value false(2) will be returned.
